description: [Status: preview] [Name: read-whole-file] [Message: Path.open() followed by read() can be replaced by {filename}.{suggestion}] What it does Checks for uses of open and read that can be replaced by pathlib methods, like Path.read_text and Path.read_bytes. Why is this bad? When reading the entire contents of a file into a variable, it's simpler and more concise to use pathlib methods like Path.read_text and Path.read_bytes instead of open and read calls via with statements. Example with open("file.txt") as f: contents = f.read() Use instead: from pathlib import Path contents = Path("file.txt").read_text() Fix Safety This rule's fix is marked as unsafe if the replacement would remove comments attached to the original expression.
